description: The trap is generated when the relation of mvlan members and users changes.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvMVLANMemberStateChangeTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwConfigChangeIP a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvMvlanMemberStateOperType i 1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvMVLANIndex i -1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserIndex i 9999

description: The serial IP of configuration changes.
If the configuration changes is trigger by the command line users, the IP address is 0.0.0.0.
If it is triggered by the SNMP user, the IP address is the SNMP user's IP address.
The Trap of configuration changes will not be sent to the SNMP user
who triggered the configuration changes.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwConfigChangeIP

description: It indicates OperType.
Options:
1. add(1) -indicates the OperType is add
2. delete(2) -indicates the OperType is delete
3. block(3) -indicates the OperType is block
4. unblock(4) -indicates the OperType is unblock
5. modify(5) -indicates the OperType is modify
6. bonding(6) -indicates the OperType is bonding
7. unbonding(7) -indicates the OperType is unbonding
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvMvlanMemberStateOperType

description: Indicates the index of a multicast VLAN.
You can also fill -1 and the system will automatically allocate an index.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvMVLANIndex

description: Indicates the unique index of a multicast user.
You can also fill -1 and the system will automatically allocate an index.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserIndex

description: The trap is generated when the policy of unknown multicast based flow and IGMP packet changes.

event.Summary: Policy change for unknown multicast or IGMP flow $v3

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvFlowMulticastPolicyChangeTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwConfigChangeIP a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvFlowMulticastPolicyOperType i 1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvFlowID i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUnknownMulticastTrafficPolicy i 2 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvIgmpPacketPolicy i 1

description: The serial IP of configuration changes.
If the configuration changes is trigger by the command line users, the IP address is 0.0.0.0.
If it is triggered by the SNMP user, the IP address is the SNMP user's IP address.
The Trap of configuration changes will not be sent to the SNMP user
who triggered the configuration changes.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwConfigChangeIP

description: It indicates the opertype of unknown multicastpolicy and IGMP packet policy change.
Options:
1. modify(1) -indicates the opertype of unknown multicastpolicy and IGMP packet policy change
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvFlowMulticastPolicyOperType

description: Indicates the service flow ID. Its value and algorithm are the same as those of hwExtSrvFlowIndex.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvFlowID

description: Indicates the suppression policy of unknown multicast streams.
Options:
1. transparent(2) -indicates the suppression policy of unknown multicast stream is transparent
2. discard(3) -indicates the suppression policy of unknown multicast stream is discard
For the switching-oriented service flow, it is discard(3) by default.
For the connection-oriented service flow, it is transparent(2) and does not support the set operation.
Default: discard(3)
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUnknownMulticastTrafficPolicy

description: Indicates the processing mode of IGMP packets.
Options:
1. normal(1) -indicates the processing mode of IGMP packets is normal
2. transparent(2) -indicates the processing mode of IGMP packets is transparent
3. discard(3) -indicates the processing mode of IGMP packets is discard
Default: normal(1)
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvIgmpPacketPolicy

description: The trap is generated when the user static join BTV simulation.
tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvSmltStaticJoinTrap HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinIndex i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinUserIndex i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinIPAddr a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinRequestID i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinVlan i 1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinRate i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinResult i 8

$SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvSmltStaticJoinTrap HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinIndex i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinUserIndex i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinIPAddr a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinRequestID i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinVlan i 1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinRate i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinResult i 2

$SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvSmltStaticJoinTrap HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinIndex i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinUserIndex i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinIPAddr a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinRequestID i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinVlan i 1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinRate i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinResult i 5

description: Indicates the BTV emulation index. Currently, only one emulation user is supported.
Always fill 1 for the index. You can also fill -1 and the system will automatically
allocate an index.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinIndex

description: Indicates the index of a multicast user, corresponding to hwDslamNtvUserIndex
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinUserIndex

description: Indicates the IP address of an emulation program. It is the IP address of the multicast program.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinIPAddr

description: It indicates the request ID of the NTV user static join trap.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinRequestID

description: Indicates the emulation program VLAN.
Range: 1-4095
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinVlan

description: Indicates the emulation program traffic.
Unit: kbit/s.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinRate

description: Indicates the emulation result. Options:
1. inProgress(1) -started, but the final result is not obtained.
2. success(2) -demand a program successfully and receive the traffic
3. onlineWithoutTraffic(3) -the user demands a program normally but does not receive the traffic
4. unknownError(4) -demand failure caused by an exception
5. systemBusy(5) -the system is busy
6. noResources(6) -a lack of memory resources
7. userBlocked(7) -the user is blocked
8. cacFail(8) -user CAC check fails
9. authFail(9) -user authentication fails
10. previewFull(10) -the maximum preview count is reached
11. channelFull(11) -the maximum number of channels is reached
12. gradedChannelFull(12) -the number of channels at this grade reaches the maximum
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserStaticJoinResult

description: The trap is generated when the NTV user configuration changes.
tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserChangeTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwConfigChangeIP a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserChangeType i 1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserAuthority i -1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserOperStatus i 2 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserAdminStatus i 1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserMaxChannel i 1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserEnableLog i 1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserVpi i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserVci i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserFlowType i -1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserFlowPara i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserUsedBandwidth i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserUsdBwthPcntToPortRate i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserIfIndex i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserIndex i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserMatchPara i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserMaxBandWidth u 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserVideoVpi i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserVideoVci i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserVideoFlowType i -1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserVideoFlowPara i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserQuickLeaveMode i 1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvReceiveGlobalLeave i 1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserFlowMode i -1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserProfileBitMap s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserFlowID i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserVideoFlowID i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserMatchPara2 i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserIgmpVersion i 1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserMldQueryVersion i -1

$SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserChangeTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwConfigChangeIP a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserChangeType i 1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserAuthority i -1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserOperStatus i 1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserAdminStatus i 1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserMaxChannel i 1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserEnableLog i 1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserVpi i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserVci i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserFlowType i -1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserFlowPara i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserUsedBandwidth i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserUsdBwthPcntToPortRate i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserIfIndex i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserIndex i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserMatchPara i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserMaxBandWidth u 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserVideoVpi i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserVideoVci i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserVideoFlowType i -1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserVideoFlowPara i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserQuickLeaveMode i 1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvReceiveGlobalLeave i 1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserFlowMode i -1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserProfileBitMap s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserFlowID i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserVideoFlowID i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserMatchPara2 i 9999 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserIgmpVersion i 1 HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserMldQueryVersion i -1

description: The serial IP of configuration changes.
If the configuration changes is trigger by the command line users, the IP address is 0.0.0.0.
If it is triggered by the SNMP user, the IP address is the SNMP user's IP address.
The Trap of configuration changes will not be sent to the SNMP user
who triggered the configuration changes.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwConfigChangeIP

description: It indicates the NTV user change type.
Options:
1. addUser(1) -indicates the NTV user change type is addUser
2. deleteUser(2) -indicates the NTV user change type is deleteUser
3. blockUser(3) -indicates the NTV user change type is blockUser
4. unBlockUser(4) -indicates the NTV user change type is unBlockUser
5. modifyUser(5) -indicates the NTV user change type is modifyUser
6. bindProfileToUser(6) -indicates the NTV user change type is bindProfileToUser
7. unBindProfileToUser(7) -indicates the NTV user change type is unBindProfileToUser
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserChangeType

description: Indicates the user authentication attribute.
Options:
1. auth(1) -indicates the user authentication attribute is auth
2. noauth(2) -indicates the user authentication attribute is noauth
the user has authority to watch all programs.
3. invalid(-1) -indicates the user authentication attribute is invalid
Default: noauth(2)
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserAuthority

description: Indicates the current running status of a multicast user. This leaf supports only the query operation.
When hwDslamNtvUserAdminStatus is block(1), this leaf must be block(3); when hwDslamNtvUserAdminStatus
is unblock(2) and a user is watching a program, this leaf is online(1); when hwDslamNtvUserAdminStatus
is unblock(2) and no user is watching programs, this leaf is offline(2). Options of hwDslamNtvUserOperStatus:
Options:
1. online(1) -indicates a user is watching program
2. offline(2) -indicates no user is watching program
3. block(3) -indicates the leaf hwDslamNtvUserAdminStatus is block(1)
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserOperStatus

description: Indicates the management status of a multicast user. It is used to set whether allow a user to watch programs.
Options:
1. block(1) -indicates a user can watch program
2. unblock(2) -indicates a user can watch program
Default: unblock(2).
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserAdminStatus

description: Indicates the maximum number of concurrent channels that can be watched by a user.
Range: 1-255
Default: 8
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserMaxChannel

description: Indicates the log switch. Options:
Options:
1. true(1) -indicates the log switch is on
2. false(2) -indicates the log switch is off
Default: true(1)
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserEnableLog

description: Indicates the VPI of the PVC carrying IGMP packets. This leaf
and the VCI leaf together identify an xDSL user. The value range
is determined by the xDSL line specifications. In a none-ATM type,
the returned value for hwDslamNtvUserVpi is -1.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserVpi

description: Indicates the VCI of the PVC carrying IGMP packets. This leaf and
the VPI leaf together identify an xDSL user. The value range is
determined by the xDSL line specifications. In a none-ATM type,
the returned value for hwDslamNtvUserVci is -1.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserVci

description: Indicates the traffic stream type. If this leaf is not issued, it indicates the single-service traffic.
Options:
1. byUserVlan(1) -indicates the traffic stream type is byUserVlan
2. byEncap(2) -indicates the traffic stream type is byEncap
3. by8021p(3) -indicates the traffic stream type is by8021p
4. byUserVlanEtherType(4) -indicates the traffic stream type is byUserVlanEtherType
5. otherType(255) -indicates the traffic stream type is otherType
6. singleFlow(-1) -indicates the traffic stream type is singleFlow
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserFlowType

description: Specifies the parameter value of the flow type. The parameter value varies with the flow type. In detail:
1. If the flow type is byUserVlan (1), the range of this parameter is 1-4095. If the flow type is untagged,
this parameter is -1.
2. If the flow type is byEncap (2), the options of this parameter are ipv4oe(0), ipoe(1), pppoe(2) and ipv6oe(3).
3. If the flow type is by8021p (3), the range of this parameter is 0-7.
4. If the flow type is byUserVlanEtherType(4), the flow parameter is a combination of the EtherType and the user VLAN.
5. If the flow type is otherType(255), the flow parameter is an invalid value, and this parameter is -1.
The EtherType can be ipoe(1) or pppoe(2), and the user VLAN is in the range of 1-4095, 0 (priority-tagged),
and untagged(-1). For the service flow of the byUserVlanEtherType(4) type, this leaf supports only reading,
and does not support creation.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserFlowPara

description: Indicates the used bandwidth of a user. When bandwidth management is disabled,
the returned value for hwDslamNtvUserUsedBandwidth is -1.
Unit: kbit/s.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserUsedBandwidth

description: Indicates the percentage of the used bandwidth to the bandwidth allocated to the igmp user.
When bandwidth management is disabled or the bandwidth is not limited, the returned value
for hwDslamNtvUserUsdBwthPcntToPortRate is -1.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserUsdBwthPcntToPortRate

description: Indicates the port index, corresponding to the shelf ID and slot ID of the port.
Its value and algorithm are the same as those of ifIndex.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserIfIndex

description: Indicates the unique index of a multicast user.
You can also fill -1 and the system will automatically allocate an index.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserIndex

description: Supported by only GPON and EPON. For an EPON port or a GPON port in the profile mode,
it indicates ontid; for a GPON port in the non-profile mode, it indicates gemportid.
The range is determined by the line specifications. In a none-xPON type, the returned
value for hwDslamNtvUserMatchPara is -1.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserMatchPara

description: Indicates the maximum multicast bandwidth.
Unit: kbit/s
Default: noLimit(4294967295)
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserMaxBandWidth

description: Indicates the VPI of the traffic stream carrying the multicast video service.
The range is determined by the xDSL line specifications. In a none-ATM type,
the returned value for hwDslamNtvUserVideoVpi is -1.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserVideoVpi

description: Indicates the VCI of the traffic stream carrying the multicast video service.
The range is determined by the xDSL line specifications. In a none-ATM type,
the returned value for hwDslamNtvUserVideoVci is -1.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserVideoVci

description: Indicates the flow type of the multicast video stream.
If this leaf is not issued, it indicates the single-service traffic.
Options:
1. byUserVlan(1) -indicates the flow type of the multicast video stream is byUserVlan
2. byEncap(2) -indicates the flow type of the multicast video stream is byEncap
3. by8021p(3) -indicates the flow type of the multicast video stream is by8021p
4. byUserVlanEtherType(4) -indicates the flow type of the multicast video stream is byUserVlanEtherType
5. invalid(-1) -indicates the flow type of the multicast video stream is invalid
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserVideoFlowType

description: Specifies the parameter value of the flow carrying the multicast video service.
The parameter value varies with the flow type. In detail:
1. If the flow type is byUserVlan (1), the range of this parameter is 1-4095.
If the flow type is untagged, this parameter is -1.
2. If the flow type is byEncap (2), the options of this parameter are ipv4oe(0), ipoe(1), pppoe(2) and ipv6oe(3).
3. If the flow type is by8021p (3), the range of this parameter is 0-7.
4. If the flow type is byUserVlanEtherType(4), the flow parameter is a combination
of the EtherType and the user VLAN. The EtherType can be ipoe(1) or pppoe(2),
and the user VLAN is in the range of 1-4095, 0 (priority-tagged), and untagged(-1).
For the service flow of the byUserVlanEtherType(4) type, this leaf supports only reading,
and does not support creation.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserVideoFlowPara

description: Indicates the quick leave attribute of a user. Options:
1. immediate(1) -indicates the quick leave attribute of a user is immediate
2. macBased(2) -indicates the quick leave attribute of a user is macBased
3. disable(3) -indicates the quick leave attribute of a user is disable
In the OAM dynamic mode, the default value is disable(3); in other modes,
the default value is macBased(2).
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserQuickLeaveMode

description: Indicates the switch of whether to receive the global leave packet sent from the user side.
Options:
1. enable(1) -indicates receive the global leave packet sent from the user side
2. disable(2) -indicates not receive the global leave packet sent from the user side
Default: disable(2).
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvReceiveGlobalLeave

description: Indicates the xDSL mode. The traffic stream on a non-xDSL board need not be issued with this leaf.
Options:
1. ptm(1) -indicates the xDSL mode is ptm
2. atm(2) -indicates the xDSL mode is atm
3. invalid(-1) -indicates invalid xDSL mode
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserFlowMode

description: The bit map indicates the relationship between user and user profile index.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserProfileBitMap

description: Indicates the ID of the flow carrying the user IGMP protocol.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserFlowID

description: Indicates the ID of the flow carrying the multicast video service.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserVideoFlowID

description: Indicates the gemindex of a GPON port in the profile mode of a GPON board.
This leaf need not be issued for a non-GPON board or in the GPON non-profile mode.
When the GPON mode is profile mode and the service board is a GPON board, the returned
value for hwDslamNtvUserMatchPara2 is gemindex. Otherwise, the returned value is -1.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserMatchPara2

description: Indicates the querier IGMP version of user .
Options:
1. v2(1) -indicates the querier IGMP version of user is v2.
2. v3(2) -indicates the querier IGMP version of user is v3.
3. v3Forced(3) -indicates the querier IGMP version of user is v3Forced, which forced the query message version is v3.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserIgmpVersion

description: Indicates the querier MLD version of user .
Options:
1. v2(1) -indicates the querier MLD version of user is v2.
2. v2Special(2) -indicates a version of query packet is determined by the version of the host.
3. invalid(-1) -indicates the querier MLD version of user is invalid.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DSLAM-NTV-MIB::hwDslamNtvUserMldQueryVersion
